content.description: This is one of the easier routes at Taylor, great for starting out on trad.  The route starts on the left side of the base of the Sun Deck.  Near the last 25 feet of climbing stay to the left, if you don't you will see a off-width crack that raises the rating to a 5.10c, which is Hurtin' for Certain.  There are no anchors at the top, but you will now be on the Sun Deck and can walk down to the left.
content.protection: Standard rack - 1s and 2s, a few nuts, you can actually place a 4 near the top.

content.description:
This is a stiff and strenuous climb. Work up to where

Tourist

and Hurtin' diverge. Work up into the + vertical dish using finger nail crimps and teeny foot holds. Find your balance and stand up tall.

There is a bird beak flake up and right that provides a tenuous undercling / pinch grip. That hold allows you to work your feet up and start laybacking and stemming up the steep head wall to the extremely difficult, thin, exit crack.
content.location: Immediately to the right of Hurtin' fer Certain.

content.description: This is also called Mantel Alley. Start at the left corner at the beginning of the first buttress. Bridge the overhang and do a left hand mantel (crux). From there, it is easy to reach the Sundeck.
content.protection: Cams to 3", no anchors; The Sundeck is a great point for anchoring.
content.location: This can be found at the first buttress in Taylor Canyon Harmel's, there is a 5.4 5.5 climb/walk to the bottom from the south side of The Sundeck.

content.description:
This is a BURLY OW crack of local historical significance as a "testpiece". It is easy to get to by climbing up the first half of the

Tourist Route

but very intimidating to start. Lieback up and into the all too obvious crack, then swim, swim, swim.
content.protection: Mostly a stripped down rack of wide gear. If you are leading it, you won't be stopping to place gear too often.
content.location: Lurking like a vertical sneer directly above the parking lot, this "Old School" trad route leads straight up to the Sun Deck.
